page.title: 04Transport: St. Erth Station
page.content: The Great Western Railway (G.W.R.)railway line to Penzance opened in l852, the line to St.Ives later, St,Erth Station developed from a halt to a junction. In l942 records show that the station employed 36 people with no less than 8 women porters. During the war the station had a large seasonable goods section sending away to markets in London, the Midlands, and the North, early potatoes, broccoli (Cornish cauliflower) and sugar beet. The goods section is now closed down and leased out to a scrap dealer.
